amendment.description: An amendment numbered 5 printed in Part B of House Report 116-154 to Requires information on Federal compliance with applicable privacy, civil rights, and civil liberties policies and protections, including protections against the public release of personally identifiable information of individuals involved in domestic terrorist incidents, investigations, indictments, prosecutions, or convictions. Includes provisions to improve data quality and information regarding domestic terrorist incidents.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Thompson (MS) amendment (A005) Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A005) offered by Mr. Thompson (MS).
Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Thompson (MS) amendment (A005) Agreed to by voice vote.
